update.description:
A few heightmap fixes in this PR:

* Fix loading DEM size in rendering when the `<size>` is not specified. It should now use the size info in the DEM file

* Enable loading DEMs with negative elevations / heights

* Fix ODE heightmap bounding box limits (models were not colliding with DEM heightmaps with certain min/max elevations)

* Fix DEM height z scale calculation. 

* Removed `try/catch` block in `Scene` when creating a heightmap - it was masking a couple of OGRE exceptions which should now be fixed.

I added some TODOs in the code as a reminder to address them later after merging forward to gazebo8 so we don't break ABI.

jenkins:

[gpu-nividia](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/676/) - ok 

[abi](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/112/API_ABI_report/) - ok
update.title: Fix DEM heightmap size, collision, scale

pullrequest.title: Fix DEM heightmap size, collision, scale

content.raw: Before, we were considering NODATA values (holes) as negative values. We were able to identify and ignore them or assume height `0`. Right now, if the NODATA value is negative we're not able to filter it and will affect the way we construct the heightmap. I don't have a file with me right now with NODATA values to test but I believe it would be safer to test one. Other than that, the changes look good to me.
content.html: Before, we were considering NODATA values (holes) as negative values. We were able to identify and ignore them or assume height 0. Right now, if the NODATA value is negative we're not able to filter it and will affect the way we construct the heightmap. I don't have a file with me right now with NODATA values to test but I believe it would be safer to test one. Other than that, the changes look good to me.

content.raw: I think this is equivalent to `height <= (1.0 + 1e-6)` right? It seems clearer to explicitly account for the default tolerance used in `ignition::math::equal`
content.html: I think this is equivalent to height <= (1.0 + 1e-6) right? It seems clearer to explicitly account for the default tolerance used in ignition::math::equal

content.raw: The derived classes, [ImageHeightmap](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/eb2bf8f988cdb05d667891dfdefa18616b1099cf/gazebo/common/ImageHeightmap.hh?at=heightmap_size_7&fileviewer=file-view-default) and [Dem](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/eb2bf8f988cdb05d667891dfdefa18616b1099cf/gazebo/common/Dem.hh?at=heightmap_size_7&fileviewer=file-view-default), will need to have a different implementation. `ImageHeightmap` will always return 0 and `Dem` will return the actual min elevation.
content.html: The derived classes, ImageHeightmap and Dem, will need to have a different implementation. ImageHeightmap will always return 0 and Dem will return the actual min elevation.
